intro: Minthostachys, commonly known as the mountain mint, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lamiaceae. These plants are characterized by their aromatic foliage and showy, often blue or purple flowers. They are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in temperate and subtropical areas. Minthostachys species typically grow in moist, well-drained soils and thrive in partial to full sunlight. Many species are used in herbal medicine and as ornamental plants due to their attractive appearance and pleasant scent.
